properties.name: Capella Market
properties.description: Posted by Ean 2489 Willamette St, Eugene, ORNoteworthy GF products available by brand: Kinnikinnick: bagels, breads, pizza crust, doughnuts, muffins Glutino: bagels Amy\'s: rice crust pizza, frozen dinners

properties.name: Glenwood (campus location)
properties.description: Posted by Ean 1340 Alder St, Eugene, ORGF breakfast: - "Glenwood breakfast": 2 eggs, sausage, bacon, side of fruit

properties.name: Lila Davachi
properties.description: Posted by Ean new york, new york

properties.name: Lucky Noodle
properties.description: Posted by Ean207 E 5th Ave, Eugene, OR

properties.name: Market of Choice
properties.description: Posted by Ean 2858 Willamette St, Eugene, ORHas a good selection of GF foods.

properties.name: Mekalas
properties.description: Posted by Ean 1769 Franklin Blvd, Eugene, ORGF: Phad Tai (verified 2/06). This is the only dish I\'ve tried there (and asked them about). Almost certainly others are GF too. Note: I contacted a few of the other main Tai joints in town and they all said they use soy sauce in their peanut sauce.

properties.name: Muchas Gracias
properties.description: Posted by Ean 1535 Franklin Blvd, Eugene, ORA very inexpensive place to get pretty good Mexican food. Open 24 hrs; even has a drive-through. They have a lot on their menu, and likely much of it is gluten free, but the things I\'ve tried and found to be safe (GF) are: - Enchiladas - Huevos Rancheros - Chicken Tacos

properties.name: Neal J. Cohen
properties.description: Posted by Ean 901 West Illinois Street, urbana illinois

properties.name: Paula Hertel, Trinity University
properties.description: Posted by Ean San Antonio, Texas 78212-7200

properties.name: Pegasus Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Ean 790 E 14th Ave, Eugene, ORGF: salad, with chicken, without croutons; and if, like me, the basic salad won\'t fill you, you can add multiple chicken breasts. Note: the pizza here is highly regarded by those who can eat it.

properties.name: Penelope's Mediterranean Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Ean 291 E 5th Ave, Eugene, ORGF dinner entre\': mixed grill kabob (comes with rice pilaf, vegetables) Though the wait staff here are awkward, the food was quite good.

properties.name: Poppi's Anatolia
properties.description: Posted by Ean 992 Willamette St, Eugene, ORFood type: Mediterranean; Indian. GF food I\'ve tried: "Standard curry chicken"; other chicken dishes; rice pudding dessert. Notes: One waitress, as of 03/06, is GF, so is knowledgeable about what\'s safe to eat.

properties.name: Ring of Fire
properties.description: Posted by Ean 1099 Chambers St, Eugene, ORThe two times I\'ve eaten here the serving staff have been very helpful in pointing out which items on the menu do not contain gluten. I was told that in the kitchen they have a list of dishes and which allergens each contains. So this means they\'re likely conscientious about cross contamination when preparing the food. Gluten free items I\'ve tried: Phad Thai (but note: the dressing that comes on the included salad is NOT gluten free, so ask for an alternative).

properties.name: Ron's Island Grill
properties.description: Posted by Ean 55 W 29th Ave, Eugene, ORGF: Kalua Pork slowly cooked (by itself, i.e., without soy sauce; this was verified with chef 01/06) and served with white rice. I\'ve eaten this plate plain (without sauce) multiple times and enjoyed it that way thoroughly; but if you have a favorite GF sauce to add yourself, all the better.

properties.description: Posted by Ean 811 7th Avenue on 53rd Street, new york, nyThe conference hotel
